result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis F Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dennis F Kratz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dennis F Kratz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Court orders defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel, as defendant requested court appointed counsel on October 10, 2016.  Counsel was appointed.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis F Kratz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

1:07 pm
Defendant Dennis F Kratz appeared in court and without counsel.
Defendant makes statement that he lost his job but has started working again.
Court orders Defendant to pay $50 per month, beginning July 31, 2017, and continuing the last day of every month, until paid in full or contact Clerk of Courts office with reasonable explanation as to why payment cannot be paid.
Court authorizes Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with payment plan.
Court adjourned at 1:09 pm
FTP Hearing July 24, 2017, for $705.50

Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

ADDRESS INFO for Dennis F Kratz
Current: 320 N Clinton St, Princeton, WI 54968 United States  (Effective: 12-12-2016)
Prior: PO Box 131, Princeton, WI 54968 United States

11:20 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant does not request counsel and will take the offer.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to count 1, will recommend a fine, costs and DNA sample and count 2 will be dismissed.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$150 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:27 a.m.
State's
Status hearing on December 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

2:11 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jon Wilsnack present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - the COC office received a phone call from the defendant that he does not want an attorney and will accept the offer from the DA.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - defendant was sent a letter with the offer from the DA.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 12, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.  Atty Wilsnack does not need to appear.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - has received the petition for appointment of counsel.  Statement by defendant - hasn't talked with any other attorneys except Atty Erik Johnson.  Court questions defendant regarding payments.  Statement by defendant, can pay $100.00 every 2 weeks.  Statement by the Court - will appoint counsel.  Defendant to stop at COC office to set up payment plan of $100.00 every 2 weeks for court appointed counsel.

Court adjourned at 9:37 am.
Status hearing on October 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

9:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, has received an offer and will accept the offer.  Court goes over right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts offer.  DA recites offer - upon plea to count 1, will recommend a fine plus court costs and count 2 will be dismissed.  Defendant passes on the offer and will obtain counsel.  Court reschedules to October 10, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:41 a.m.
Status hearing on September 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

10:50 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will waive right to counsel to talk with the DA.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant to make an appointment with the DA's office.  Court sets for Status Hearing on September 19, 2016 at 9:30 am.

Court adjourned at 10:52 a.m.
Status hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has not raised enough money for Atty Johnson and does not qualify for PD representation.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.  Court questions defendant regarding possible payments towards an attorney.

Court adjourned at 9:49 a.m.
Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:26 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - is trying to retain Atty Erik Johnson and needs more time to get the retainer fee.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:27 a.m.
Status hearing on June 21, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant called and requested an adjournment as he is retaining Atty Erik Johnson.  Informed the defendant that he is entitled to one adjournment and will adjourn to June 21, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.
43
Status hearing on June 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney, does not qualify for PD representation, knows he does not qualify.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 14, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:22 a.m.
Status hearing on May 24, 2016 at 09:15 am.

1:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via telephone from the Marquette County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 24, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.

2:42 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Corut finds probable cause for the charges.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and Initial Appearance is scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:44 p.m.
